comments:
Build 20041019

1. Create a file association for *.html to the Text Editor (for editing purposes).
2. Right click on an html file and choose Open With > System Editor.
3. A dialog appears:
Title: Problems Opening Editor
Message: Unable to open external editor for <path to file>.
(where <path to file> is the file that was selected)

Unfortunately, this worksforme on I200410190941, GTK+ 2.4.9, KDE 3.3.0, Linux 
2.6.8.1.  What kind of system are you running?  The most important detail is 
probably whether you're running KDE or GNOME, and which version.

I'm running Gnome in Mandrake 10.1. Luc has the same problem in an older version 
on Mandrake (10.0?). I mentioned that this failure occurs after setting up the 
file association, but I guess I should be explicit about the fact that before 
creating the association, double-clicking an html file successfully opens a 
system editor.

Is there a difference between the "no association, double click" code and the 
"open with > system editor" code?
P.S. That's Mandrake 10.1 Community with Gnome 2.6.

Is there anything in the log? 
 
Yes, the code path is slightly different coming into the EditorMgmt layer, but 
it is the same underneath.  Here's the traces (trimmed of meaningless stuff):

Nothing in the log. Incidentally, I tried to test if it would revert to being able to open the system editor 
again if I removed the file association, but I hit another bug, which I filed as bug 76702.
I can reproduce this problem on GNOME 2.6.2.  It does not happen on KDE 3.3.0.

This is a bug in libswt-gnome-gtk.  The problem is that it depends on liblinc,
which does not exist in GNOME 2.4 or 2.6.  Please see
"https://jdic.dev.java.net/issues/show_bug.cgi?id=79" for an example.
Reassigning to Felipe at his request.

Fixed in HEAD > 20041021

Doug, Jared, please test the new swt libraries in gnome-2.6 or 2.8. Thanks.
This works for me with SWT from HEAD.  Thank you.
